Any commons on these?  I don't think (especially with days delay) there is
much point my trying to argue all points at once, it is too out of synch.

	I think the points (one by one) that need to get agreed or dismissed are:

	1) Are test suites (as collections of tests, which have some
	hierarchical/run order effect) are a "second place" to manage relationship
	between testcases? Since managing in two places is always flawed, are
suites
	flawed? [If I refactor testcases I might forget to refactor the suites, and
	that is where errors creep in.]
	2) Are test suites becoming obsoleted by "brute force collectors"? How
would
	we know other than a user survey?
	3) If "suites" have outlived their purpose, why are they the "framework"
way
	to manage run order?
	4) Does "run order/dependency" (not side-effect dependency) have any
	value -- despite it's smell?
	5) Is "run order" something that ought be in the framework, however it is
	implemented.

regards

Adam
